title: Computer-Supported Collaborative Inquiry Learning: Enhancing Language Research Competencies and Critical Thinking Through Peer Assessment and Feedback

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and substantial practical experience in specialized fields, experience in academic writing and peer review, foundational grammar and research methodology knowledge, and basic understanding of linguistic inquiry procedures
context.additional_context: Process for enhancing research inquiry skills, critical thinking, and academic expression (writing/reading/communication) through peer assessment and dialogue in a language research simulation environment for working professionals. Mimics real research settings via role-play in VR and text-based collaboration, including analysis of diverse language materials (text/audio/video).

learning_goals: Learners can revise the clarity of language research questions and the scientific validity of data collection plans two or more times through peer evaluation.
Learners can improve the logical consistency and evidence-based validity of research conclusions by over 30% according to peer feedback and systematically integrate text analysis results.

Learners can complete over 80% of the language inquiry process (hypothesis setting → observation → analysis → conclusion) through structured academic dialogues with peers in VR-based collaborative environments.
Learners can demonstrate a collaborative attitude by fairly recognizing peer evaluation processes and accepting feedback, correcting over 50% of expression and grammatical errors in research papers.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
